alert.note: Alert for Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 1:33AM CDT until July 21 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell, Claiborne and Union. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Follette, New Tazewell, Harrogate, Jellico, Clairfield, White Oak, Fincastle, Springdale, Sandlick, Indian Mountain State Park, Arthur and Cumberland Gap. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
